title: Drawing, Playing card; king of clubs; Alexander the Great, ca. 1750
title_raw: Playing card; king of clubs; Alexander the Great
medium: a: wood engraving, body colors; b: pencil, watercolor, white heightening; cardboard
creditline: Gift of Mrs. R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes
description: a: In the type of horizontal rectangle. D'Allemagne, Les Cartes à jouer, Vol. I, pl. after p. 112. Printed along the upper part of the right edge: ALEXANDRE. Verso: b: a curved staircase leads up to a terrace in the middle plane. A part of a castle is shown in the left rear, trees upon a lower leveled part of the terrace in the right middle plane and rear. A fountain stands in the left foreground; the water pours from a mask in the upper part of a high round pedestal, supporting a figure of a seated woman.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Playing card; king of clubs; Alexander the Great, ca. 1750. a: wood engraving, body colors; b: pencil, watercolor, white heightening; cardboard. 
Gift of Mrs. R. Keith Kane from the Estate of Mrs. Robert B. Noyes. 1943-5-24
